column4: anyone know why my 32bit OS won't start up on my new 64bit motherboard? It gets to grub then just reboots.
you check your grub install?
yeah, do I need some param?
i think it's like F8 or one of those that allows you to select what kernel you boot into
have you tried the failsafe?
no failsafe option, It's a ferdoa OS
hmm let me look around
thanks
did this happen after an update?
no I just got the new MB, and now I would like to do dual boot with both OS's
have a look at this http://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/Fedora/14/html/Installation_Guide/ap-rescuemode.html
K, thanks alot
neither, I got two drives, but if I select the fedora one it just don't boot on this new 64 bit MB.
so these OS's were installed before you put in the new mobo?
that could be a problem..not for sure..but it may be
the old mobo was an ausu too, but was a 32bit dual XEON processors.
it's like how when you have a copy of windows on a hardrive, and you replace the motherboard that is totally different. The windows install panics, and you have to re-install
this maybe the case with linux
the new mobo is just the 64bit AMD FX series, and I just thought it should boot the 32 bit OS no problem, but it get up to Grub then just reboots again.
that grub install might possibly be seeing a configuration for the old motherboard, and not seeing the new one
you may have to re-install grub on the MBR of that drive
you are probably 100% ritght.
thanks for your help, I guess Im going to have to learn grub.conf options.
anytime, good luck
